meanings.definition: To cause the decline or destruction of industrial activity in a region.
meanings.sent1: The closure of the factory deindustrializes the town, leading to job losses.
meanings.sent2: As technology advances, many countries deindustrialize, shifting towards service-based economies.
meanings.sent3: The noisy machines decided to take a break and deindustrialize the entire production line.
meanings.sent4: The economic crisis deindustrialized the once-thriving city, turning it into a ghost town.
meanings.sent5: The pollution from the factories deindustrializes the environment, leaving it barren and lifeless.

meanings.definition: To transition from an industrial economy to a post-industrial economy.
meanings.sent1: The country deindustrializes slowly, adapting to new technologies and industries.
meanings.sent2: Many developed nations deindustrialize over time, focusing more on services and technology.
meanings.sent3: The old factory decided to retire and deindustrialize gracefully into a modern business park.
meanings.sent4: The city's skyline transformed as it deindustrialized, embracing a new era of innovation.
meanings.sent5: The community's mindset shifted as they deindustrialized, welcoming a future of digital advancements.
